intro.title: Recognize Good Moments
educationalText: Our brains naturally focus on threats and problems, often missing positive moments.
Training yourself to notice good moments builds resilience and improves mood over time.
intro.scientificContent:
Research in positive psychology shows that:

‚Ä¢ The brain has a negativity bias, evolved to keep us safe by focusing on threats.

‚Ä¢ Deliberately noticing positive moments rewires neural pathways, strengthening positive emotion circuits.

‚Ä¢ Regular practice of recognizing good moments is linked to reduced anxiety, better sleep, and improved overall wellbeing.

This exercise trains your attention to balance threat-detection with appreciation.

categoryA.name: Good Moment
categoryA.subtitle: (Notice this)
categoryA.educationalText: Good moments are worth pausing to notice and appreciate.

categoryB.name: Other Moment
categoryB.subtitle: (Let it pass)
categoryB.educationalText: Neutral moments are just part of daily life - no need to dwell on them.

scenarios.text: The sun feels warm on my face.
That was kind of her to help me.
My shoulders feel a bit lighter.
My friend sent me a funny meme
I finished a task I'd been putting off
My favorite song came on the radio
Whatever, I need to get moving.
It doesn't matter. I have too much to do.
I saw a cloud shaped like nothing in particular
The printer is out of paper
